result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary J Goza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Parenting classes.
Anger management assessment and followthrough.
No contact w/victim unless approved by DOC.
Give DNA sample.

Defendant Zachary J Goza in court with attorney George Steve Pappas.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews plea questionnaire.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  Remarks by Atty. White and Atty. Pappas.  Defendant makes a statement.  Court pronounces sentence.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 05-18-2015 11:15 am

Defendant Zachary J Goza in court with attorney George Steve Pappas.  Defendant Zachary J Goza in custody.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reduction of bond requested.  Defendant's sister sworn in and testifies about where he could live.  Questioned by both attorneys.  Judge reduces the bond and adds conditions.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:15 am.
for substitution of counsel

Defendant Zachary J Goza in court with attorney George Steve Pappas.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attny Pappas argues his motion for a reduction in bond and advises the Court that defendant could live with his sister or step mother.  DA objects as motion was not filed timely.  Court will continue the motion to allow DA to check matters out.  Motion hearing scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zachary J Goza in court with attorney Ronald D. Haacke.  Defendant Zachary J Goza in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing requested.  Bond reduction requested.  State opposes the reduction.  Judge denies reduction for now.  Family should contact law enforcement for assistance in removing personal belongings from the home.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
